intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium milteliphes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and flowering heads that produce bright yellow ray florets. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring temperate climates. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some habitats.
